alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 7:53PM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds and low humidity are expected to redevelop and align over the eastern plains of New Mexico Saturday afternoon where critical fire weather conditions will one again threaten. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect Saturday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast and East Central Plains of New Mexico Saturday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly at 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 or 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 11 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
